s1.title: 1. Purpose
s1.p1: These Terms of Service (ToS) define the terms and conditions for accessing and using the VideoChorus service, published by JDevelop.

s2.title: 2. Access to the service
s2.p1: VideoChorus is a free online service accessible through a web browser. No registration or account creation is required. The publisher reserves the right to modify, suspend, or discontinue the service at any time, without notice or compensation.

s3.title: 3. Use of the service
s3.p1: The user agrees to use VideoChorus in compliance with applicable laws and these Terms of Service. The user is solely responsible for their use of the service and the content they download.
s3.li1: Respect the intellectual property rights of content creators
s3.li2: Not use the service for unlawful purposes or purposes contrary to public order
s3.li3: Only download content for which they have the necessary rights or whose use is authorized
s3.li4: Not attempt to disrupt the operation of the service

s4.title: 4. Intellectual property
s4.p1: All elements constituting the VideoChorus website (design, source code, logos, text) are the exclusive property of JDevelop and are protected by intellectual property law.
s4.p2: Videos downloaded through the service remain the property of their respective authors. VideoChorus claims no rights over this content and acts solely as a technical intermediary.

s5.title: 5. Limitation of liability
s5.p1: The service is provided "as is", without warranty of any kind. JDevelop shall not be held liable for:
s5.li1: Temporary or permanent interruptions of the service
s5.li2: The use made by the user of downloaded content
s5.li3: Any direct or indirect damage resulting from the use of the service
s5.li4: The availability or quality of third-party content accessible through the service

s6.title: 6. Personal data
s6.p1: The processing of personal data is described in our <link>privacy policy</link>.

s7.title: 7. Amendments to the ToS
s7.p1: JDevelop reserves the right to modify these Terms of Service at any time. Changes take effect upon publication on the website. Continued use of the service after modification constitutes acceptance of the new Terms of Service.

s8.title: 8. Applicable law and jurisdiction
s8.p1: These Terms of Service are governed by French law. In the event of a dispute relating to the interpretation or execution of these terms, and failing amicable resolution, the competent courts of Toulouse shall have exclusive jurisdiction.

s4.title: Intellectual property
s4.p1: All content on this website (structure, text, logos, images, source code) is the exclusive property of JDevelop, unless otherwise stated. Any reproduction, representation, or distribution, in whole or in part, of this website's content without prior authorization is prohibited and constitutes infringement under articles L.335-2 and following of the French Intellectual Property Code.

s5.title: Personal data
s5.p1: For any information regarding the collection and processing of personal data, please refer to our <link>privacy policy</link>.

s1.title: 1. Data controller
s1.p1: The data controller for personal data is:
s1.address: Registered office: 6 Place du Président Thomas Woodrow Wilson, 31000 Toulouse, France

s2.title: 2. Data collected
s2.p1: VideoChorus does not require any account creation and does not collect any directly identifying personal data. The only data processed is anonymous analytics data, collected through cookies subject to your prior consent.

s3.title: 3. Cookies and trackers
s3.p1: This site uses the following cookies and trackers, only after obtaining your consent:
s3.vercelLi1: Performance metrics (Web Vitals: LCP, FID, CLS, etc.)
s3.p2: These cookies have a maximum validity of 13 months in accordance with CNIL recommendations. You can change your preferences at any time via the "Manage cookies" link at the bottom of each page.

s4.title: 4. Legal basis for processing
s4.p1: The processing of analytics data is based on your consent (Article 6, paragraph 1, point a) of the General Data Protection Regulation — GDPR). You may withdraw your consent at any time.

s5.title: 5. Data retention period
s5.p1: Analytics data is retained for a maximum of 25 months from the date of collection, in accordance with CNIL recommendations.

s6.title: 6. Your rights
s6.p1: Under the GDPR, you have the following rights:
s6.accessDesc: : obtain confirmation that data concerning you is being processed and receive a copy
s6.rectificationDesc: : request the correction of inaccurate data
s6.erasureDesc: : request the deletion of your data
s6.objectionDesc: : object to the processing of your data
s6.portabilityDesc: : receive your data in a structured, machine-readable format
s6.withdrawalDesc: at any time via the "Manage cookies" link
s6.p2: To exercise these rights, contact us at
s6.p3: In case of dispute, you may lodge a complaint with the French Data Protection Authority (CNIL):

s7.title: 7. Data transfers outside the European Union
s7.p1: Collected data may be transferred to the United States through the following services:
s7.vercelDesc: (US hosting) — website hosting and performance metrics
s7.p2: These transfers are governed by Standard Contractual Clauses (SCCs) approved by the European Commission, in accordance with Article 46 of the GDPR.
